description: A classic Filipino chicken noodle soup with tender chicken, elbow macaroni, and carrots in a savory, creamy broth.
ingredient: [{"name": "vegetable oil", "units": "tablespoons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "white or yellow onion", "units": "medium", "amount": 1}, {"name": "garlic", "units": "cloves", "amount": 2}, {"name": "celery", "units": "stalk", "amount": 1}, {"name": "carrots", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "patis (fish sauce)", "units": "tablespoon", "amount": 1}, {"name": "dry pasta (elbow macaroni)", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "cooked chicken", "units": "cup", "amount": 1}, {"name": "chicken stock", "units": "cartons", "amount": 2}, {"name": "Kosher salt", "units": "to taste", "amount": null}, {"name": "black pepper", "units": "teaspoon", "amount": "1/4"}, {"name": "milk", "units": "cup", "amount": "1/4"}]
step_by_step: ["In a large pot over medium heat, add the oil. Saut√© the onion, garlic, celery, and carrot until soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes. Add the fish sauce and stir.", "Add the pasta and chicken and stir to combine. Add the chicken stock. Increase the heat to medium-high heat and bring to a simmer, then cover and reduce the heat and let cook until the macaroni is tender, about 10 minutes.", "Season with salt and pepper to taste. Turn off the heat and add the milk. Stir so that all ingredients combine well. Serve piping hot in individual soup bowls."]
notes: For an extra-hearty meal, serve this Macaroni Chicken Soup with fresh bread or dinner rolls.
